intro: Bupleurum montanum var. baboranum, commonly known as the Baboran mountain angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
